blog.name: vendielove
blog.title: Venom and Eddie's Poly Paradise
blog.description: Ships Ahoy! 21+ ONLY-  NSFW Indie Selective Rp run by Rawiya (Buckinwildstory) with Eddie Brock and his NonBinary Symbiote calling all the shots.

body:
Oily Medicine

Eddie brock has been, well the media calls him a sugar baby, except he’s too ugly for that. Whatever, he’s been dating Tony for well over six months now.

They’ve slept together for most of that time. So when Eddie realizes that he’s heading, not to the lab or to their room or to the couch, but to the guest room he keeps a few things in, he knows something’s wrong.

“Venom, darling?” He tries, only once he’s spoken realizing just how thick the cotton is in his skull and how much his sinuses throb with the noise.

It isn’t until he doesn’t get an answer that he really understands something is wrong.

His mind feels battered and wrapped in cotton batting at the same time. He struggles to make sense of it all. “Venom, come on, love, talk to me.” He tries a bit more frantic.

Tired. Sick. The voice in his head is grumpy and lethargic, and… yeah. That’s what that feeling is. He hasn’t had the cold or a sniffle since he got Venom nearly three years ago now.

“He don’t go to sleep yet, are we contagious? Do we need to do anything?” Eddie prods Venom in his mind and the response is annoyed and aggrieved sounding this time.

Noooo only we can catch it. Neeed to sleeeep. The last comes out a whine, and Eddie feels awful qll at once, body swaying as he struggles with a crushing exhaustion pulling his limbs all at once.

“Hey, J, can… you tell Tony, I’m… sick, but probably not contagious?” Eddie says, the words pulled taffy slow and distant, his body staggering towards the bed, too wiped to do more than kick off his shoes as he flops face first on the bed. He tries to say sorry or probably best to stay away just in case… but all that comes out is a long low whine as he drags the blankets over himself and curls around a pillow.

He is sweaty and shaking and miserable.

He really wishes Tony were here rubbing his back.

by Anna Marie Darkholme (WierdAlienFantasies)

Nebula is left standing on the ruins of Titan with nothing but dust.
Dust and memories.
Dust, memories and an awful revelation.

tags: 10 out of 10 should write and send to me
summary: Torture Show: Staring Wade Wilson (Spideypool because why not?)
title: Torture Show: Staring Wade Wilson (Spideypool because why not?)
body:
Deadpool gets tutored in front of the Avengers by Francis are forced to watch unable to get to him, (not that all are actually willing to hep him at first: Tony) and Francis uses the opportunity to taunt Wade telling him his life will never been like his life before and he’s cursed to live with that fact no matter how hard he tries to end it.

And why not back it Spideypool? 

Eventually happy-ish ending, which just means Deadpool is no longer being tortured and Francis is out of commission, but Wade feels wide open and vulnerable, not willing to let anyone in.

MORGAN. 24. FEMALE. MASTERLIST. FAQs. ASK.
REQUESTS: OPEN BUT THERE MAY BE A DELAY

title: BROADWAY BEAUTY
body:
TONY STARK x READER
WORD COUNT : 1387
WARNINGS : JUST SOME FLUFF
REQUESTED BY : @carolyn-stark-91 (Thank you!)

SUMMARY : When the team interrupts Tony’s work to drag him to a musical, he tries to find every excuse not to go and every reason to complain. But when the show starts and he lays eyes on you, everything changes, and Tony will do anything to meet you- even if it means attending the show for the next five nights.

“How many times do I have to tell you, I don’t have time,” Tony groaned as he flexed the arm of the new suit he was making, “and musical theater isn’t exactly my style.”

Natasha stood against the door frame with her arms crossed, refusing to back down. “It’s a Sunday. You can make time. All Wanda wanted for her birthday is for us to go see Wicked with her. Everyone else is getting ready and we’re going to take her to dinner beforehand.”

“I bought everyone’s tickets. Isn’t that enough?” Tony responded without taking so much as a glance away from his tools, “I’ll buy everyone’s dinner, too.”

“No, that isn’t enough. We all easily could’ve bought our own tickets, and Steve is already buying dinner. She doesn’t want your money, she wants you there. She wants one good birthday where the world isn’t falling apart, and she wants her family there. That, unfortunately, includes you. Be ready by 5 or else I’m giving the soldiers the codes to your suits.”

“You wouldn’t dare,” Tony squeaked, finally dropping the screwdriver in his hand and looking at Natasha wide-eyed and actually intimidated.

“I would,” she smirked, “and just imagine how much damaged they’d cause trying to figure out how to fly those things.”

Without another word she sauntered off down the hallway, leaving Tony with little choice but to attend the dinner and the show.

Realizing how little time he actually had he rushed to shower and change into the first steamed suit and tie he laid his hands on. He someone managed to make it to the tower lobby with just a minute to spare. Everyone was waiting in the lobby for him, but was surprised that he managed to be on time.

Bucky’s gift to Wanda was a limo ride to dinner and the theatre, so Wanda, Natasha, Peter, and Pietro all climbed in gracefully, and Bucky, Steve, Clint, and Bruce all squeezed in behind them.

Dinner went well (with Tony only whispering 10 of the 30 complaints to Natasha that he wanted to make) and the food was delicious. Steve made a toast to Wanda during dessert, and then everyone loaded back into the limo to head to the theatre.

Tony had scored third row center orchestra seats for everyone through a chain of connections that he had. While everyone excitedly picked their seats, he slouched into the one beside Peter, already dreading the next three hours.

The show started, and Tony was already struggling to keep himself awake, his mind wandering to unfinished projects and undrafted ideas.

“Fellow Ozians…”

“Who is she?” Tony whispered with a gasp, sitting up suddenly on the edge of his seat.

“Let us be glad,” you sang, “Let us be grateful.”

His eyes lit up as he leaned into every word that poured off your tongue, basking in your beauty and grace. His eyes were glued to you every moment that you were on that stage, and every moment you weren’t there he anxiously waited for you to appear again.

During the intermission he stole Steve’s playbill (having already thrown his own away when they walked in the door) and immediately searched for your name. He made a note of it, intending on searching for you in every database he had in order to find you and ask you out.

When the show ended, he begged to stay behind to meet you, but the group wanted to go out for drinks and Natasha wasn’t about to let Tony make the night about him.

When he finally made it back to the tower, he searched restlessly for any chance of contacting you, but you were a surprisingly private person, so he failed to find so much as an email address. So, he decided to introduce himself in person.

He showed up Monday night with flowers in hand only to realize there wasn’t a show that evening, and went home incredibly disappointed.

Tuesday night he returned with a similar bouquet and begged a manager to let him see you, but the manager insisted that without a backstage VIP pass- which had already sold out for the entire week- he wouldn’t be allowed back to meet you.

Somehow he managed to get one of the passes on Wednesday through his connection, but you had left immediately after the show due to feeling under the weather.

He returned again on Thursday, to find you had been temporarily replaced by your standby, who was beautiful and talented but just not you.

By Friday, he was ready to give up, but decided to try one more time. He purchased a VIP pass with a front row ticket, and collected the flowers of the previous bouquets that were still alive and added them to a fresh one he purchased on his way to the theatre. He wore his sharpest suit and waited through the musical one last time, hanging onto your every word and hoping with every fiber in him that he’d get the chance to meet you.

The show ended and he rushed to the entrance to backstage. He handed the pass along with a stack of $100 bills to the guard on his way to your dressing room, stammering something about how he absolutely had to see you. The guard threatened to stop him, but having recognized him from the past few nights, seeing the flowers in his hands, and knowing just how much money he’d spent to see you over the course of that week, he was interested in seeing how this played out. So the guard kept a safe distance, giving Tony space but ready to plow him over if he proved to be an actual threat to you.

Tony stopped outside of your dressing room door. He quickly and nervously ran a hand through his hair and then down the front of his suit jacket to make sure it wasn’t wrinkled. He fluffed the bouquet to make it look as fresh as possible, and then anxiously knocked on your door.

He had a whole speech planned, intended to woo you and win your heart, but when you opened the door, he fell speechless. His jaw dropped at just how beautiful you were up close, and he could’ve sworn you could hear his heart thumping in his chest.

You were surprised, at first, to see such a handsome stranger with such a large offering of flowers in his hands at your door, but suddenly you recognized him as the man who had sat in the front section for the past few shows and was the talk of the cast all week. Rumor had spread quickly that a famous billionaire was coming to the shows just for you, but you often stayed happily oblivious of the headlines and the news, so you didn’t know who it was that they were actually talking about.

“Hi,” you beamed as the realization fell on you, and you were glad that he was as handsome as they had described, “I’m Y/N, I’ve heard you’ve come to a few shows this week. Thank you so much! I’m so sorry I haven’t been available to meet you, things just kept coming up. What’s your name again?”

You held out your hand to formally introduce yourself, but he held out the flowers to you instead, licking his lips as he opened and closed his mouth repeatedly, trying to find the words to say.

“I’m in love with you,” he stammered, “I- I mean- I’m Tony Stark.”

As you flashed a flattered smile and took the flowers from his hands, his trance was somehow broken long enough to straighten out his collar and clear his throat. He tried to feign enough confidence and maintain his normally presumptuous demeanor, but when his eyes met yours again, he faltered.

“Would you have dinner with me?” he asked, his voice cracking in his nervousness.

You peaked over Tony’s shoulder to see the entire cast and crew gathered just a few feet away, not even trying to hide their ogling stares and gleeful smiles. You felt like you were in a dream, but you knew you would be absolutely foolish to pass up an opportunity like this, and something about his relentless persistence but still adorable nervousness made your heart flutter.

“I’d love that.”

MASTERLIST

body_abstract:
TONY STARK x READER
WORD COUNT : 1387
WARNINGS : JUST SOME FLUFF
REQUESTED BY : @carolyn-stark-91 (Thank you!)

SUMMARY : When the team interrupts Tony’s work to drag him to a musical, he tries to find every excuse not to go and every reason to complain. But when the show starts and he lays eyes on you, everything changes, and Tony will do anything to meet you- even if it means attending the show for the next five nights.

reblog.comment:
TONY STARK x READER
WORD COUNT : 1387
WARNINGS : JUST SOME FLUFF
REQUESTED BY : @carolyn-stark-91 (Thank you!)

SUMMARY : When the team interrupts Tony’s work to drag him to a musical, he tries to find every excuse not to go and every reason to complain. But when the show starts and he lays eyes on you, everything changes, and Tony will do anything to meet you- even if it means attending the show for the next five nights.

[[MORE]]

“How many times do I have to tell you, I don’t have time,” Tony groaned as he flexed the arm of the new suit he was making, “and musical theater isn’t exactly my style.”

Natasha stood against the door frame with her arms crossed, refusing to back down. “It’s a Sunday. You can make time. All Wanda wanted for her birthday is for us to go see Wicked with her. Everyone else is getting ready and we’re going to take her to dinner beforehand.”

“I bought everyone’s tickets. Isn’t that enough?” Tony responded without taking so much as a glance away from his tools, “I’ll buy everyone’s dinner, too.”

“No, that isn’t enough. We all easily could’ve bought our own tickets, and Steve is already buying dinner. She doesn’t want your money, she wants you there. She wants one good birthday where the world isn’t falling apart, and she wants her family there. That, unfortunately, includes you. Be ready by 5 or else I’m giving the soldiers the codes to your suits.”

“You wouldn’t dare,” Tony squeaked, finally dropping the screwdriver in his hand and looking at Natasha wide-eyed and actually intimidated.

“I would,” she smirked, “and just imagine how much damaged they’d cause trying to figure out how to fly those things.”

Without another word she sauntered off down the hallway, leaving Tony with little choice but to attend the dinner and the show.

Realizing how little time he actually had he rushed to shower and change into the first steamed suit and tie he laid his hands on. He someone managed to make it to the tower lobby with just a minute to spare. Everyone was waiting in the lobby for him, but was surprised that he managed to be on time.

Bucky’s gift to Wanda was a limo ride to dinner and the theatre, so Wanda, Natasha, Peter, and Pietro all climbed in gracefully, and Bucky, Steve, Clint, and Bruce all squeezed in behind them.

Dinner went well (with Tony only whispering 10 of the 30 complaints to Natasha that he wanted to make) and the food was delicious. Steve made a toast to Wanda during dessert, and then everyone loaded back into the limo to head to the theatre.

Tony had scored third row center orchestra seats for everyone through a chain of connections that he had. While everyone excitedly picked their seats, he slouched into the one beside Peter, already dreading the next three hours.

The show started, and Tony was already struggling to keep himself awake, his mind wandering to unfinished projects and undrafted ideas.

“Fellow Ozians…”

“Who is she?” Tony whispered with a gasp, sitting up suddenly on the edge of his seat.

“Let us be glad,” you sang, “Let us be grateful.”

His eyes lit up as he leaned into every word that poured off your tongue, basking in your beauty and grace. His eyes were glued to you every moment that you were on that stage, and every moment you weren’t there he anxiously waited for you to appear again.

During the intermission he stole Steve’s playbill (having already thrown his own away when they walked in the door) and immediately searched for your name. He made a note of it, intending on searching for you in every database he had in order to find you and ask you out.

When the show ended, he begged to stay behind to meet you, but the group wanted to go out for drinks and Natasha wasn’t about to let Tony make the night about him.

When he finally made it back to the tower, he searched restlessly for any chance of contacting you, but you were a surprisingly private person, so he failed to find so much as an email address. So, he decided to introduce himself in person.

He showed up Monday night with flowers in hand only to realize there wasn’t a show that evening, and went home incredibly disappointed.

Tuesday night he returned with a similar bouquet and begged a manager to let him see you, but the manager insisted that without a backstage VIP pass- which had already sold out for the entire week- he wouldn’t be allowed back to meet you.

Somehow he managed to get one of the passes on Wednesday through his connection, but you had left immediately after the show due to feeling under the weather.

He returned again on Thursday, to find you had been temporarily replaced by your standby, who was beautiful and talented but just not you.

By Friday, he was ready to give up, but decided to try one more time. He purchased a VIP pass with a front row ticket, and collected the flowers of the previous bouquets that were still alive and added them to a fresh one he purchased on his way to the theatre. He wore his sharpest suit and waited through the musical one last time, hanging onto your every word and hoping with every fiber in him that he’d get the chance to meet you.

The show ended and he rushed to the entrance to backstage. He handed the pass along with a stack of $100 bills to the guard on his way to your dressing room, stammering something about how he absolutely had to see you. The guard threatened to stop him, but having recognized him from the past few nights, seeing the flowers in his hands, and knowing just how much money he’d spent to see you over the course of that week, he was interested in seeing how this played out. So the guard kept a safe distance, giving Tony space but ready to plow him over if he proved to be an actual threat to you.

Tony stopped outside of your dressing room door. He quickly and nervously ran a hand through his hair and then down the front of his suit jacket to make sure it wasn’t wrinkled. He fluffed the bouquet to make it look as fresh as possible, and then anxiously knocked on your door.

He had a whole speech planned, intended to woo you and win your heart, but when you opened the door, he fell speechless. His jaw dropped at just how beautiful you were up close, and he could’ve sworn you could hear his heart thumping in his chest.

You were surprised, at first, to see such a handsome stranger with such a large offering of flowers in his hands at your door, but suddenly you recognized him as the man who had sat in the front section for the past few shows and was the talk of the cast all week. Rumor had spread quickly that a famous billionaire was coming to the shows just for you, but you often stayed happily oblivious of the headlines and the news, so you didn’t know who it was that they were actually talking about.

“Hi,” you beamed as the realization fell on you, and you were glad that he was as handsome as they had described, “I’m Y/N, I’ve heard you’ve come to a few shows this week. Thank you so much! I’m so sorry I haven’t been available to meet you, things just kept coming up. What’s your name again?”

You held out your hand to formally introduce yourself, but he held out the flowers to you instead, licking his lips as he opened and closed his mouth repeatedly, trying to find the words to say.

“I’m in love with you,” he stammered, “I- I mean- I’m Tony Stark.”

As you flashed a flattered smile and took the flowers from his hands, his trance was somehow broken long enough to straighten out his collar and clear his throat. He tried to feign enough confidence and maintain his normally presumptuous demeanor, but when his eyes met yours again, he faltered.

“Would you have dinner with me?” he asked, his voice cracking in his nervousness.

You peaked over Tony’s shoulder to see the entire cast and crew gathered just a few feet away, not even trying to hide their ogling stares and gleeful smiles. You felt like you were in a dream, but you knew you would be absolutely foolish to pass up an opportunity like this, and something about his relentless persistence but still adorable nervousness made your heart flutter.

“I’d love that.”

MASTERLIST

The show started, and Tony was already struggling to keep himself awake, his mind wandering to unfinished projects and undrafted ideas.

“Fellow Ozians…”

“Who is she?” Tony whispered with a gasp, sitting up suddenly on the edge of his seat.

“Let us be glad,” you sang, “Let us be grateful.”

His eyes lit up as he leaned into every word that poured off your tongue, basking in your beauty and grace. His eyes were glued to you every moment that you were on that stage, and every moment you weren’t there he anxiously waited for you to appear again.

During the intermission he stole Steve’s playbill (having already thrown his own away when they walked in the door) and immediately searched for your name. He made a note of it, intending on searching for you in every database he had in order to find you and ask you out.

When the show ended, he begged to stay behind to meet you, but the group wanted to go out for drinks and Natasha wasn’t about to let Tony make the night about him.

When he finally made it back to the tower, he searched restlessly for any chance of contacting you, but you were a surprisingly private person, so he failed to find so much as an email address. So, he decided to introduce himself in person.

He showed up Monday night with flowers in hand only to realize there wasn’t a show that evening, and went home incredibly disappointed.

Tuesday night he returned with a similar bouquet and begged a manager to let him see you, but the manager insisted that without a backstage VIP pass- which had already sold out for the entire week- he wouldn’t be allowed back to meet you.

Somehow he managed to get one of the passes on Wednesday through his connection, but you had left immediately after the show due to feeling under the weather.

He returned again on Thursday, to find you had been temporarily replaced by your standby, who was beautiful and talented but just not you.

By Friday, he was ready to give up, but decided to try one more time. He purchased a VIP pass with a front row ticket, and collected the flowers of the previous bouquets that were still alive and added them to a fresh one he purchased on his way to the theatre. He wore his sharpest suit and waited through the musical one last time, hanging onto your every word and hoping with every fiber in him that he’d get the chance to meet you.

The show ended and he rushed to the entrance to backstage. He handed the pass along with a stack of $100 bills to the guard on his way to your dressing room, stammering something about how he absolutely had to see you. The guard threatened to stop him, but having recognized him from the past few nights, seeing the flowers in his hands, and knowing just how much money he’d spent to see you over the course of that week, he was interested in seeing how this played out. So the guard kept a safe distance, giving Tony space but ready to plow him over if he proved to be an actual threat to you.

Tony stopped outside of your dressing room door. He quickly and nervously ran a hand through his hair and then down the front of his suit jacket to make sure it wasn’t wrinkled. He fluffed the bouquet to make it look as fresh as possible, and then anxiously knocked on your door.

He had a whole speech planned, intended to woo you and win your heart, but when you opened the door, he fell speechless. His jaw dropped at just how beautiful you were up close, and he could’ve sworn you could hear his heart thumping in his chest.

You were surprised, at first, to see such a handsome stranger with such a large offering of flowers in his hands at your door, but suddenly you recognized him as the man who had sat in the front section for the past few shows and was the talk of the cast all week. Rumor had spread quickly that a famous billionaire was coming to the shows just for you, but you often stayed happily oblivious of the headlines and the news, so you didn’t know who it was that they were actually talking about.

“Hi,” you beamed as the realization fell on you, and you were glad that he was as handsome as they had described, “I’m Y/N, I’ve heard you’ve come to a few shows this week. Thank you so much! I’m so sorry I haven’t been available to meet you, things just kept coming up. What’s your name again?”

You held out your hand to formally introduce yourself, but he held out the flowers to you instead, licking his lips as he opened and closed his mouth repeatedly, trying to find the words to say.

“I’m in love with you,” he stammered, “I- I mean- I’m Tony Stark.”

As you flashed a flattered smile and took the flowers from his hands, his trance was somehow broken long enough to straighten out his collar and clear his throat. He tried to feign enough confidence and maintain his normally presumptuous demeanor, but when his eyes met yours again, he faltered.

“Would you have dinner with me?” he asked, his voice cracking in his nervousness.

You peaked over Tony’s shoulder to see the entire cast and crew gathered just a few feet away, not even trying to hide their ogling stares and gleeful smiles. You felt like you were in a dream, but you knew you would be absolutely foolish to pass up an opportunity like this, and something about his relentless persistence but still adorable nervousness made your heart flutter.

“I’d love that.”

MASTERLIST

trail.content_abstract:
TONY STARK x READER
WORD COUNT : 1387
WARNINGS : JUST SOME FLUFF
REQUESTED BY : @carolyn-stark-91 (Thank you!)

SUMMARY : When the team interrupts Tony’s work to drag him to a musical, he tries to find every excuse not to go and every reason to complain. But when the show starts and he lays eyes on you, everything changes, and Tony will do anything to meet you- even if it means attending the show for the next five nights.

title: When The Time Comes

summary:
Steve: What size shoes do you wear?
Tony: Uh, eleven, eleven and a half.
Steve: Great, because my shoes are giving me a little...
body:
Steve: What size shoes do you wear?

Tony: Uh, eleven, eleven and a half.

Steve: Great, because my shoes are giving me a little problem on the dance floor, can I borrow the boots?

Tony: Uh, I don’t even really know where I left those. Sorry.

Steve: [looks at Tony’s feet] Those aren’t eleven and a half.

Tony: Okay fine! I’m a seven! All right, I have surprisingly small feet. But the rest of me is good, I’ll show ya!
